medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had a 1-week history of sore throat, vomiting, fever, and headache. Symptoms progressed to coma and myoclonus one week after presentation, leading to intubation and further decline in mental status.
medical_history.family_history: Hair follicles from the patient, his mother, and his daughter had detectable HHV-6, suggesting chromosomally integrated HHV-6 infection.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a married software engineer with 2 young children and had traveled to China 7 months prior to presentation.
